flawed_nl_solution:
Book 1 was $12.50 and book 2 was $15.00 so 13 +15 = $28
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 28 * 0.25 = $7
These two books came out to 28-7 = $<<28-7=17>>17
Books 3 & 4 were both $10 each so 2*10 = $20
When you add all 4 books together, 17+20 = $<<17+20=37>>37
To get free shipping he would need to spend 50-37 = $<<50-37=13>>13 more on books
#### 13

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 21, not 17. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
